intro: Psychotria capensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species native to southern Africa. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
